movies.title: The King of the Duplicators
movies.plot: This MGM short film highlights the work of master make-up artist . As the head of MGM's make-up department, Bill Tuttle has been involved in many of MGM's best known productions. He shows how they make masks of actors' faces that allows them to work on make-up, particularly prostheses or appliances, without the actor having to spend hours in the make-up room.
movies.simplePlot: This MGM short film highlights the work of master make-up artist . As the head of MGM's make-up department, Bill Tuttle has been involved in many of MGM's best known ...

biography.bio: William Tuttle was born in Jacksonville, Florida, in 1911. At the age of 15 he was forced to leave school in order to earn a living so he could support his mother and younger brother, Thomas Tuttle. His music background got him work with comedy teams and a burlesque orchestra and, finally, his own band. At age 18 he moved to Hollywood, California. He eventually ended up working at Fox studios. He became an apprentice to Jack Dawn, head of makeup at Twentieth-Century Pictures. Seven months later Twentieth Century closed down for the summer in 1934 and Bill went to MGM to continue his apprenticeship. Fox hired Bill as a makeup artist after seeing the work he had done at MGM. He worked on three films for Fox before returning to MGM, and made it his home for 35 years. For eight years he worked as an assistant to Jack Dawn (by then head makeup artist at MGM) and, after Jack retired, he became the head of the department for over 20 years. William Tuttle and Charles H. Schram both worked on The Time Machine (1960). Bill had taken a trip to the San Diego Zoo and got the idea to use the fur of an East African species of monkey for the fur of the Morlocks. He won an honorary Oscar in April 1965 for his work on George Pal's 7 Faces of Dr. Lao (1964). He has taught at the USC film school and created his own line of cosmetics, Custom Color Cosmetics.
biography.name: William Tuttle

biography.bio: Wayne Thomas was born on August 13, 1931 in Oakland, California, USA as Michael Wayne Thomas. He was an actor and producer, known for The King of the Duplicators (1968), The Amazing Howard Hughes (1977) and Zebra in the Kitchen (1965). He died on January 27, 2009 in Alhambra, California.
biography.name: Wayne Thomas

biography.bio: Charles H. Schram was born on March 21, 1911 in Los Angeles, California, USA as Charles Herman Schram. He is known for his work on The Godfather: Part II (1974), Papillon (1973) and Being There (1979). He died on November 14, 2008 in Simi Valley, California.
biography.name: Charles H. Schram

filmingLocations.location: Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer Studios - 10202 W. Washington Blvd., Culver City, California, USA
